data.title: Torque Game Engine Games
data.meta_description: Popular, low cost game engine developed by Garage Games.
data.text:
The Age of Decadence

October 14, 2015

PC

The Age of Decadence is an isometric, turn-based, single-player 3D role-playing game set in a low magic, post-apocalyptic fantasy world, inspired by the fall of the Roman Empire. The game features a detailed skill-based character system, non-linear gameplay, multiple skill-based ways to handle quests, choices & consequences, and extensive dialogue trees.

Dead State

December 4, 2014

PC

An open world zombie survival RPG. It promises to focus on the survivor mentality and social interactions that arise from such a disaster scenario.

Lore: Aftermath

2009

PC

Lore: Aftermath is a multiplayer action mech-sim, built on Garage Game's 'Torque' engine and was available on their InstantAction web gaming service. Max Gaming Technologies is currently preparing a standalone release of the game in Q4 2012.

Valhyre

January 20, 2009

XBGS

Valhyre Deathmatch is a shooter that serves as a proof of concept for the upcoming MMORPG Valhyre: The Aftermath. It was released as an XNA community game for the Xbox 360.

Ace of Aces

December 19, 2008

PC

Ace of Aces is a multiplayer flight combat simulator, built on Garage Game's 'Torque' engine and previously available on their InstantAction web gaming service.

Penguins Arena: Sedna's World

December 18, 2008

MAC

PC

This is a "first penguin shooter" where the purpose is to save the penguins.

Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness - Episode Two

October 29, 2008

MAC

XBGS

+ 2 more

PS3N

PC

Penny Arcade: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness: Episode 2 is the second in a series of episodic adventure role-playing games from Hothead Games and the creators of the titular webcomic.

Hinterland

September 30, 2008

PC

The newest game from Tilted Mill the makers of Caesar 4 and Children of the Nile. Loot, level and build with fast paced RPG combat and strategic base building!

SPOGS Racing

July 7, 2008

WSHP

SPOGS Racing is a racing video game published by D2C Games and developed by Pronto Games for the Wii. It was released as a WiiWare title in North America on July 7, 2008, and in Europe on July 18, 2008. It costs 1000 Wii Points and takes up 264 Blocks.

Penny Arcade Adventures: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness - Episode One

May 20, 2008

MAC

XBGS

+ 2 more

PS3N

PC

On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness is an adventure-oriented role-playing game from the creators of Penny Arcade, a gaming-themed online comic strip.

Rocketmen: Axis of Evil

March 5, 2008

XBGS

PS3N

Defend the human race from nefarious aliens in this downloadable dual-joystick shooter from Capcom, based on the Rocketmen game by WizKids.

Screwjumper!

November 14, 2007

XBGS

Screwjumper! was an action game released for Xbox Live Arcade. It has since been delisted making it no longer available to purchase.

Scudbuster

March 2007

PC

Missile Command in 3D. Launch missiles at your enemy and shoot down the incomming missiles with your Patriot battery.

Blockland

February 28, 2007

MAC

PC

Blockland is an indie game for Windows and Mac with a focus on building, user-created content, and a variety of game modes.

Civil Disturbance

2006

PC

A PC first-person shooter set in a future America where an oppressed populace rebels against the government.

TubeTwist: Quantum-Flux Edition

December 8, 2006

MAC

PC

After things go awry in Professor Jaymour's laboratory, the professor is lost in a time warp and it is up to a handful of students to free her. To do this the player must reconstruct her experiments by connecting a series of tubes.
